description: Identify the reported error.
Think through and plan the optimal way to fix the error, step by step.
Add debugging output as appropriate to try and troubleshoot the error
Avoid renaming any files; if you must, ask the user for explicit permission first
Proceed with a fix only if it's the best approach.
Make code changes to resolve the identified error.
Write only the minimal required code to deliver the correction.
After fixing the error, review the entire file to identify and remedy:
- Duplicate declarations or duplicate code
- Syntax or indentation errors
- Non-adherence to best practices or project/user rules
- Undefined variables
After fixing the error, review the entire directory to identify and remedy other instances of the same error
Check if the new or changed code has any dependencies (or if it replaced any code with dependencies).
Search across the whole folder/project for impacted or dependent files.
Update all related dependencies accordingly.
Limit code changes strictly to what is needed for this error/task.
Avoid changes for any other issues, and do not add unnecessary code.
Document the debugging process and insights in 'learnings_from_debugging.md' (do not create a new file; use the one in the directory).
If the file cannot be found, alert the user.
Follow the documentation format provided inside the 'How to document' section of the .md file.
At all times, adhere to project rules and specific user-provided rules.
